resources.description:
User personas are archetypical users whose goals and characteristics
							represent the needs of a larger group of users. Usually, a persona is a composite of several
							real users.
resources.author: Adobe

resources.title: How to Define a User Persona
resources.description:
As you break into a career in UX, user personas are one tool you’ll
							certainly want to have available as you gather user research and find design solutions to
							solve problems and create more human-friendly products and experiences.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: Introduction to Developing User Personas
resources.description:
You can create the best service with the most modern technology, but
							if you do not understand the user’s preferences and desires, our efforts towards creating
							the best service are easily lost.
resources.author: Judit Kertesz

resources.title:
What Are User Personas? How to Create Personas in 4
								Steps
resources.description:
Developing an accurate picture of your customers doesn’t need to cost
							you large amounts of money and effort.
resources.author: Louis Grenier

resources.title: An Overview of User Personas
resources.description:
Personas help product teams with exactly that: to understand,
							empathize with, and design for their target users, thereby putting faces to people they are
							designing for.
resources.author: UX Planet

resources.title: Intro to Personas in UX Design
resources.description:
In this video, we’ll cover what personas are, why they’re important, and
							how to create them.
resources.author: Jamal Nichols

resources.title: What are Personas?
resources.description:
What are personas and why are they so crucial to the design process?
							Explore the different types of personas, as well as how to create and make use of them, in
							this topic definition video from UX expert William Hudson.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: How To Create A User Persona (Video Guide)
resources.description:
In this video, we’ll walk you through the process of creating a user
							persona.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: Creating Personas for User Experience Research
resources.description:
We’ll cover the basics of personas, how to create them, and how to use
							them in your research.
resources.author: PlaybookUX

resources.title: User journey map
resources.description:
A user journey map (also known as a customer journey map) is a diagram
							that visually illustrates the user flow through your site, starting with initial contact or
							discovery, and continuing through the process of engagement into long-term loyalty and
							advocacy.
resources.author: Optimizely

resources.title: Journey Mapping 101
resources.description:
Journey mapping is a process that provides a holistic view of the
							customer experience by uncovering moments of both frustration and delight along the way.
resources.author: Nielsen Norman Group

resources.title: A Beginner's Guide To User Journey Mapping
resources.description:
‘How do people actually use our product?’ is a fundamental question that
							every product creator must answer. In order to answer this question, product designers need
							to understand the essence of the whole experience from the user’s perspective.
resources.author: Nick Babich

resources.title: What are User Flows in User Experience (UX) Design?
resources.description:
The concept of flow in UX design was first coined by the psychologist
							Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi. He deemed it a highly focused mental state where the user is fully
							immersed in what they are doing and the task they aim to accomplish.
resources.author: Camren Browne

resources.title: How to create a UX Sitemap: a simple guideline
resources.description:
Sometimes UX design requires the perspective of a kid, full of curiosity,
							to find new heights. By creating a UX sitemap, you’ll be able to take an early glance at
							your website or application from the tree tops. Let’s look at the what, when, how, and why
							of UX sitemaps.
resources.author: Jennifer Jhang

resources.title: Customer Journey Mapping 101
resources.description:
The 5 components of a journey map and the benefits of using this
							qualitative method as part of a UX design process to discover, document, and share the
							bigger picture of what users want.
resources.author: NNgroup

resources.title: How to make a User Journey Map
resources.description:
Hey guys! I hope you enjoy today's video about how to make a user
							journey map. This is one of my favorite tools to utilize at the beginning stages of a
							project. Journey mapping is all about visualizing a narrative for a selective actor or user
							group in your product.
resources.author: Mallory Dean

resources.title: Customer Journey Map Workshop
resources.description:
In this video, we’ll walk you through the process of creating a user
							journey map.
resources.author: PlaybookUX

resources.title: Customer Journey Mapping Tutorial
resources.description:
In this video, I teach you the basics of customer journey mapping,
							followed by a tutorial. This is one of the most powerful techniques you can use to
							dramatically improve the customer experience and the performance of your business.
resources.author: Jesper Lowgren

resources.title: How to do User Story Mapping
resources.description:
A practical guide of how to do user story mapping. In this lesson
							we'll be covering how you can get the stories from your product backlog ready for
							software development.
resources.author: UXClub

resources.title: UX Design - Why you NEED to know User Flows!
resources.description:
Today, we're stepping into the world of UX design and we're
							going to tackle a common task: creating a user flow diagram. In this video, I'll
							address the what, why and how of ux design flows. I will also create my own user flow for
							the upcoming relaunch of DesignCourse.com so that you can see a user flow constructed in a
							real-world context.
resources.author: DesignCourse

resources.title: Create User Flow Diagrams From Customer Journey Maps
resources.description:
Learn how to create user flow diagrams from customer journey maps in the
							UX design process with Billy, Head of Design at Headway.
resources.author: Headway

resources.title: What is User Testing? - Learn UX - Keep It Usable
resources.description:
User testing, aka usability testing, user research, UX testing…
							everyone’s talking about it, all the best companies are doing it, but what exactly is user
							testing? And why are your peers banging on about it so much?
resources.author: KeepItUsable

resources.title: 6 Simple Steps to Conduct User Testing Successfully
resources.description:
User testing, or usability testing, is a key component in designing,
							finalizing and launching a great digital product. It’s about detecting usability issues at
							any stage of the product development cycle with the aim of improving the overall user
							experience.
resources.author: Adam Fard

resources.title: How to Conduct a Heuristic Evaluation
resources.description:
Heuristic evaluation is a usability inspection method for finding
							problems in a design. It is a method of usability inspection that helps to find usability
							problems in a design.
resources.author: Hsin-Jou Lin

resources.title: Usability Testing 101
resources.description:
Usability testing is a method of evaluating a product by testing it on
							users. It is a common practice designed to find usability problems early in the development
							cycle.
resources.author: Nielsen Norman Group

resources.title: 8 Usability Testing Methods That Work
resources.description:
Usability testing is a powerful tool for evaluating a website's
							functionality and making sure people can navigate it efficiently. In this section, we
							explore different usability testing methods, when you should use them, and why.
resources.author: HotJar

resources.title: Conducting an Heuristic Evaluation
resources.description:
Heuristic evaluation is a process where experts use rules of thumb to
							measure the usability of user interfaces in independent walkthroughs and report issues.
resources.author: Olympia U.

resources.title:
The A to Z of UX — H is for Heuristics: 9 steps to carry out a
								heuristic evaluation
resources.description:
Heuristics are a well established and accepted list of UX principles used
							to assess how well a user interface has been designed for its intended purpose.
resources.author: Darren Wilson

resources.title: User & Usability Testing - Methods & Tips
resources.description:
What is user testing? User testing is a technique used in user-centered
							design to evaluate a proposed solution or product by testing it with real or potential
							users.
resources.author: Adobe

resources.title: Heuristic Evaluation: GoodReads, LibraryThing, Litsy
resources.description:
Heuristic evaluation is a great way to test and discover usability issues
							of your product and competitors’ as well.
resources.author: Nóra Sárga

resources.title: Uncovering Secrets of User Testing in 5 Minutes!
resources.description:
In this video, you'll learn how to uncover secrets of user
							testing in just 5 minutes! User testing is an essential part of the user experience design
							process, and this video will teach you how to use it to your advantage.
resources.author: Antony Conboy

resources.title: You need to know Usability Testing (with Maze)
resources.description:
In this video, you'll learn how to conduct usability testing with
							Maze. Usability testing is a method of evaluating a product by testing it on users. It is a
							common practice designed to find usability problems early in the development cycle.
resources.author: DesignCourse

resources.title: Intro to Usability Testing and Heuristic Evaluations
resources.description:
Learn about Intro to Usability Testing and Heuristic Evaluations. Yves
							Rannou, Professor @ Humber College.
resources.author: Yves Rannou

resources.title:
Usability Testing Tips & Tools: Powerful UX Research
								Method
resources.description:
ProjectUX creator and UX Researcher Rob Andrews breaks down the
							process of usability testing with some specific tips and tools to help you with this
							powerful UX method of user research.
resources.author: ProjectUX

resources.title: The 10 Usability Heuristics
resources.description:
The 10 basic principles for designing a good user experience: these
							have remained true for decades, since they were introduced for heuristic evaluation of user
							interfaces.
resources.author: NNgroup

resources.title:
A Beginner's Guide To Information Architecture in UX
								[2023]
resources.description:
If you’ve heard about UX design, you’ve probably come across information
							architecture, or as it’s often written for short ‘IA’.
resources.author: Pia Kluncar

resources.title:
Information Architecture Guide for UX Architects &
								Designers
resources.description:
If you want to build a great house, the person to call is an architect.
							We all know this, but architecture applies not only to traditional buildings but also to the
							information space.
resources.author: Nick Babich

resources.title: The UX Process for Information Architecture
resources.description:
Learn about information architecture—how designers and product managers
							build an IA using design principles, as well as IA tools and best practices.
resources.author: James Pikover

resources.title: Information Architecture. Basics for Designers.
resources.description:
The World Wide Web contains a tremendous amount of information which is
							hard to imagine unstructured because a human brain wouldn’t be able to perceive any single
							thing.
resources.author: Tubik

resources.title: Information Architecture Design: A Step-By-Step Guide
resources.description:
Information architecture is a discipline that focuses on organizing
							information within digital products clearly and logically. It helps users answer the
							question, “Where can I find the information I’m looking for?”
resources.author: Nick Babich

resources.title: A Beginner’s Guide To Information Architecture
resources.description:
In this video, you'll find a comprehensive introduction to
							information architecture. Learn exactly what information architecture is and why it's
							so important, and discover an easy-to-follow process for defining the information
							architecture of your website.
resources.author: Toptal

resources.title: What Is Information Architecture? (UX Design Guide)
resources.description:
In this video, Maureen will give you an introduction to information
							architecture, as well as detailing the three key components to good information
							architecture: the user, the content, and the context.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: Information Architecture (IA)
resources.description:
In this video, you'll learn about information architecture (IA), a
							discipline that focuses on organizing information within digital products clearly and
							logically.
resources.author: NNgroup

resources.title:
Information Architecture & Sketching for UI/UX
								Projects
resources.description:
I go through my process for determining important touch-points, putting
							together the information architecture for the app, and starting to sketch the important
							flows.
resources.author: Maddy Beard

resources.title: What is Interaction Design?
resources.description:
Interaction design is an important component within the giant umbrella of
							user experience (UX) design. In this article, we’ll explain what interaction design is, some
							useful models of interaction design, as well as briefly describe what an interaction
							designer usually does.
resources.author: Interaction Design Foundation

resources.title: Complete Beginner’s Guide to Interaction Design
resources.description:
Interaction design has its origins in web and graphic design, but has
							grown into a realm of its own. Far from merely working with text and pictures, interaction
							designers are now responsible for creating every element on the screen that a user might
							swipe, click, tap, or type: in short, the interactions of an experience.
resources.author: UX Booth

resources.title: What is Interaction Design?
resources.description:
Interaction design is a specialized discipline within UX design. Where UX
							looks at the entire user experience and how everything ties together to create a cohesive
							experience, interaction design focuses on the interactions between the user and the product.
resources.author: UX Pin

resources.title: What Is Interaction Design in UX Development?
resources.description:
Interaction design (IxD) is a connection between a product and the user.
							The role of interaction design is to give users information concisely and efficiently to
							help them accomplish their goals.
resources.author: Indeed

resources.title: Basics of Interaction Design
resources.description:
In this video, you'll learn about the basics of interaction design.
							You'll learn about the different types of interaction design, the different types of
							interaction design roles, and the different types of interaction design tools.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: What is Interaction Design
resources.description:
In this video, I give a very basic overview of what Interaction Design is
							in a UX context.
resources.author: Jamal

resources.title: User Experience Design vs Interaction Design
resources.description:
There’s a lot of common area between the two fields, and both of the
							design disciplines strives to improve overall User Experience with a product/service.
resources.author: Club UX

resources.title:
What is Interaction Design? Learn Interaction Design in Product
								Design like a Pro!
resources.description:
In this tutorial, we will learn about Interaction Design for Mobile Apps
							and get into the core basics and depth of what Interaction Design is.
resources.author: Design Pilot

resources.title: Interaction Design and Tasks
resources.description:
In this video, you'll learn about the basics of interaction design.
							You'll learn about the different types of interaction design, and how to design for
							tasks.
resources.author: Udacity

resources.title: Better UX Through Microinteractions
resources.description:
Microinteractions are single interactive moments in a product that
							enhance the workflow and make a product more enjoyable. This article highlights key parts of
							microinteractions and patterns.
resources.author: Ondřej

resources.title: 10 Micro-interactions Examples and How They Boost UX
resources.description:
Micro-interactions let visitors take action and guide them through the
							things you want them to accomplish.
resources.author: Jeff Cardello

resources.title: Microinteractions in User Experience
resources.description:
Microinteractions convey system status, support error prevention, and
							communicate brand. They are initiated by a trigger, are single-purpose, and can make the
							experience engaging.
resources.author: Alita Joyce

resources.title: The power of microinteractions in UX design
resources.description:
Microinteractions can help craft a more engaging experience, while
							providing users with feedback and a sense of satisfaction.
resources.author: ShapingDesign

resources.title:
How Micro Interactions have become an essential part of great
								products.
resources.description:
The world of User Experience design is growing fast, everyone wants their
							user to have the best experience. There are many ways to improve the user experience,
							including defining personas, well-structured information architecture and thoughtful written
							content.
resources.author: Prayag Gangadharan

resources.title:
Micro-interactions: why, when and how to use them to improve
								the user experience
resources.description:
Micro-interactions are events which have one main task — a single purpose
							— and they’re found all over your device and within apps. Their purpose is to delight the
							user; to create a moment that is engaging, welcoming and, dare we say it — human.
resources.author: Vamsi Batchu

resources.title: Creating meaningful micro-interactions
resources.description:
While design solves universal problems, micro-interactions are the
							delightful moments your users have while using the product.
resources.author: Denislav Jeliazkov

resources.title:
Micro-interactions in Figma under 9 mins-UI Animation Series -
								09
resources.description:
In this video of the UI Animation series, we'll create 2
							micro-interactions inside Figma.
resources.author: Design with Aashish

resources.title: Awesome Micro Animations With Figma Tutorial
resources.description:
In this video, I will show you how to create awesome micro animations
							with Figma.
resources.author: developedbyed

resources.title: How to create complex micro interactions in Figma!
resources.description:
In one of my previous videos, I showed some examples of
							micro-interactions with smooth and complex animations. in this video, I will remake one of
							them to show how you can do it in Figma.
resources.author: Kimo

resources.title: UI Animation Series in Figma
resources.description:
In this video, you'll learn about the basics of interaction design.
							You'll learn about the different types of interaction design, and how to design for
							tasks.
resources.author: Design with Aashish

resources.title: An Introduction to Prototyping in UX Design
resources.description:
Prototyping is an essential part of any UX design process. It allows
							designers to quickly and easily create a working model of their design that can be tested
							and iterated upon.
resources.author: DesignGuru

resources.title: 4 Steps to Build Your Product's First Prototype
resources.description:
Here are four steps to get your first prototype built so you can turn
							your idea into a patented, profitable product.
resources.author: Cherie Nelson

resources.title: Guide to prototyping in Figma
resources.description:
We will cover the basics of prototyping in Figma, including how to create
							a prototype, how to add interactions, and how to share your prototype.
resources.author: Figma

resources.title:
5 Common Low-Fidelity Prototypes and Their Best
								Practices
resources.description:
Low-fidelity prototypes allow us to quickly and inexpensively test ideas,
							so we can validate our hypotheses and improve our solutions.
resources.author: Rikke Friis Dam & Teo Yu Siang

resources.title:
Perfect Your UX Design Process: A Guide to Prototype
								Design
resources.description:
The process of prototyping—from creating simple wireframes to testing
							fully functional mockups—is one of the most potent and powerful set of skills any designer
							can master. It’s also fraught with peril in workplaces where the process is skipped in lieu
							of just “designing a prototype” as a simple deliverable to give to the next department to
							build.
resources.author: Judit Casacuberta

resources.title: Figma Tutorial - Prototyping in Figma
resources.description:
In this video, we will cover the basics of prototyping in Figma,
							including how to create a prototype, how to add interactions, and how to share your
							prototype.
resources.author: Butter Academy

resources.title: What is prototyping?
resources.description:
Prototyping is a low-cost, low-risk way of developing, testing, and
							improving ideas at an early stage.
resources.author: Nesta

resources.title: Figma Tutorial: Prototyping & Transitions
resources.description:
In this video we'll show you how to add simple transitions to your
							prototypes.
resources.author: Figma

resources.title: Learn Figma Prototyping
resources.description:
Master interaction design with Figma Prototyping. Create an animated app
							experience using after delay, scrolling content, video prototype.
resources.author: DesignCode

resources.title: What Is A Wireframe? Your Best Guide
resources.description:
A wireframe is a low-fidelity prototype that is used to test and validate
							design assumptions.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: What is wireframing
resources.description:
Wireframing is a way to design a website service at the structural level.
							A wireframe is commonly used to layout content and functionality on a page which takes into
							account user needs and user journeys.
resources.author: Experience UX

resources.title: What Are Wireframes?
resources.description:
A wireframe is a schematic or blueprint that is useful for helping you,
							your programmers and designers think and communicate about the structure of the software or
							website you're building.
resources.author: Balsamiq Wireframing Academy

resources.title: Low-Fidelity Prototypes
resources.description:
Low-fidelity prototyping is a fundamental phase in the web design
							process. Ideas and concepts are presented using simple lines and shapes (e.g. boxes for
							content blocks, circles for photos, etc.), without concern for aesthetics or detailed
							content.
resources.author: TillerDigital

resources.title:
Prototyping vs Wireframing: What's The
								Difference?
resources.description:
A wireframe is low-fidelity that takes less time to create, while a
							prototype is high-fidelity that is more time consuming.
resources.author: The Product Manager

resources.title: Wireframing – Low Fidelity vs. High Fidelity
resources.description:
In this video Alvin talks about the difference between Lo-fi vs. High-fi
							wireframes, when to best use them respectively and also some examples of what they might
							look like.
resources.author: Relab Studios

resources.title: Build Wireframes and Low-Fidelity Prototypes
resources.description:
In this video, we will cover the basics of prototyping in Figma,
							including how to create a prototype, how to add interactions, and how to share your
							prototype.
resources.author: My Lesson

resources.title: Free Figma Tutorial: Designing Wireframes with Figma
resources.description:
In this video, I'll be going over how to use Figma to design
							wireframes.
resources.author: Butter Academy

resources.title: High-fidelity prototyping: What, When, Why and How?
resources.description:
As part of the user experience design series at MOBGEN, we have recently
							covered the benefits of low-fidelity prototyping within design process of digital products.
resources.author: Eleonora Ibragimova

resources.title: What is a high-fidelity prototype?
resources.description:
A prototype is the work product of the prototyping phase of the interface
							design process. Since it is a simulation of the end product, it is used for user testing to
							identify pain points and improvements earlier in the design process.
resources.author: Zarmeen Zehra

resources.title: High-Fidelity Prototype: Why & When to Create Them
resources.description:
In this blog, we dig into high-fidelity prototypes and understand their
							benefits as well as explore a better solution at the end.
resources.author: Anurag

resources.title:
Low-fidelity vs. High-fidelity Design Prototypes (and when to use
								which)
resources.description:
User Experience (UX) is an essential element of software design, and it’s
							something software companies work to understand before spending precious resources writing
							code. Prototyping makes this possible.
resources.author: Ravneet Singh

resources.title: What are High Fidelity Prototypes?Types and Examples.
resources.description:
Often mistaken as the Final Product, High Fidelity Prototypes are closer
							to the finished product. They are highly functional and engaging but takes longer to be
							built and Costly.
resources.author: Club UX

resources.title:
High-Fidelity Prototyping Demand is GROWING! (Don’t Miss
								Out)
resources.description:
ProtoPie is the easiest prototyping tool for all digital products. Turn
							your interaction design ideas into high-fidelity prototypes for mobile, desktop, web, all
							the way to IoT. Import your designs from Figma and create dynamic prototypes beyond what
							Figma can do.
resources.author: Mizko

resources.title: Food App Design - UX/UI ( Wireframe, Prototype, Export)
resources.description:
Today we will learn to design a food app in Adobe XD. We will start with
							the wireframe and then move on to the prototype.
resources.author: DesignSesne

resources.title: Figma Mobile App Design Tutorial
resources.description:
In this Figma Mobile App Design Tutorial, you are going to learn how to
							design a Modern Mobile App in Figma. Figma is a free UI Design tool used creating Mobile App
							UI and UX.
resources.author: Building Amazing Things

resources.title: What is Design Thinking?
resources.description:
Design thinking is a non-linear, iterative process that teams use to
							understand users, challenge assumptions, redefine problems and create innovative solutions
							to prototype and test.
resources.author: Interaction Design Foundation

resources.title: The 5 Phases of Design Thinking
resources.description:
The short form of the design thinking process can be articulated in five
							steps or phases: empathize, define, ideate, prototype and test.
resources.author: AMA

resources.title: The 5 Stages in the Design Thinking Process
resources.description:
The design thinking process is a five-step process that helps you to
							solve problems and create innovative solutions. It is a human-centered approach to problem
							solving that draws from the designer’s toolkit to integrate the needs of people, the
							possibilities of technology, and the requirements for business success.
resources.author: Interaction Design Foundation

resources.title:
A Complete Guide to the Design Thinking Process in 5
								Steps
resources.description:
The Design Thinking process can be divided into five key steps:
							Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, and Test. The 5 steps in the Design Thinking process
							are:EmpathizeDefineIdeatePrototypeTest
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: 5 Stages of the Design Thinking Process
resources.description:
In life we’re always bumping into new problems, and while we have the
							desire to solve them, it’s often hard to find the right solution or even know where to
							start. That’s where “design thinking” comes in.
resources.author: InVision

resources.title: Design Thinking Full Course - Design Thinking Process
resources.description:
In this design thinking tutorial, we will be looking at what is design
							thinking, why design thing is important, steps of design thinking, empathy mapping, five
							phases and four pillars of design thinking and agile methodology with design thinking. It is
							extremely helpful in solving problems that are ill-defined or unknown. Design Thinking is an
							iterative method that helps resolve user issues or redefines problems in alternative
							strategies and solutions.
resources.author: Simplilearn

resources.title: ADVANCED DESIGN PROCESS: MUST KNOW!!
resources.description:
In this video, I will be going over the advanced design process. This is
							a process that I have developed over the years and it has helped me to create some of my
							best work.
resources.author: Satori Graphics

resources.title: UX Design Process: Empathize, Define, and Ideate
resources.description:
We will be going over the UX design process in this video. We will be
							going over the first three steps of the UX design process: Empathize, Define, and Ideate.
resources.author: My Lesson

resources.title: The Design Thinking Process (Explained By An Expert)
resources.description:
In this video, we explore the wonderful world of Design Thinking. Design
							Thinking is both an ideology and a process; it's all about solving complex problems in
							a user-centric way. Design Thinking was created as a way of taking the processes and
							approaches that designers use and applying them to problems that designers don't
							typically approach — for example: organizational design, business or marketing issues within
							a company.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: Productive design critique guide
resources.description:
A design critique is performed in order to evaluate a design and provide
							feedback on whether or not it meets business objectives and user needs.
resources.author: Alexandre Brito

resources.title:
Design Critiques: Encourage a Positive Culture to Improve
								Products
resources.description:
Open feedback is essential for a collaborative UX process. However,
							sharing unfinished work is naturally uncomfortable and often generates tension. The right
							facilitation process can foster an efficient, honest feedback loop.
resources.author: Sarah Gibbons

resources.title:
What is a Design Critique and How Can it Improve Your
								Designs?
resources.description:
Collecting feedback is an integral part of a product designer’s work –
							one which allows them to make sure that the product they’re designing is both intuitive and
							adds value to users’ lives.
resources.author: UXPin

resources.title: 5 Powerful Do’s & Don’ts of Design Critique
resources.description:
When you’re working on a team, there are a lot of opportunities for
							collaboration. But this also means there are opportunities for mixed messages, differing
							opinions, and multiple rounds of edits along the way.
resources.author: Justin Morales

resources.title: Design critiques at Figma
resources.description:
Design critiques are a key part of just about every design culture, and
							one of the few consistent rituals design teams share.
resources.author: Noah Levin

resources.title: A practical guide for design critiques
resources.description:
If you have ever taken a design or art class, you may already be familiar
							with design critiques. But as you grow as a designer, how do you know what to look out for
							when giving and receiving a design critique? In this article, we’ll share our tips.
resources.author: Monica Galvan

resources.title: Design Feedback in Action
resources.description:
Get a detailed look at giving and receiving feedback as you learn about
							design critique sessions. Watch part of a mock design critique session in action and see how
							you can turn feedback into concrete actions.
resources.author: Google

resources.title: Websites Design Critique: Student Work
resources.description:
In this video, we will be going over the websites design critique. We
							will be going over the websites design critique of a student.
resources.author: Flux Academy

resources.title: Product Design Critique Sessions for Beginners
resources.description:
In this video, I talk about product design critique sessions. This is a
							broad overview of what critiques are, why designers have critiques, who is involved, and
							tips for an effective critique. The video is geared towards beginners, design students, and
							junior designers.
resources.author: Sera Tajima

resources.title:
Critique an app with me! + tips for ux interviews (Product design
								2019)
resources.description:
I'm here to talk tips from what I've learned over the past 4
							years in hopes to help others out. Today, I walk through an app (SoundCloud - one of my
							favorites) and do a mini critique. Hope this helps!
resources.author: Shae Illustrates

resources.title: What is Accessible Design?
resources.description:
“Imagine if 90% of the websites or mobile apps you use today locked you
							out. Everyone else continues to experience the convenience of mobile banking, the
							connectedness of social media, and the freedom of online shopping, but, for you, they’re
							inaccessible. For the 57 million people with disabilities in the United States, this is
							their everyday experience.”
resources.author: Vincent Brathwaite

resources.title: How to build an accessible design system
resources.description:
People come with all different types of abilities and disabilities. By
							designing with accessibility in mind, you can open up a world of opportunities for users of
							all abilities to engage with your work.
resources.author: Eric Chung

resources.title: What is Accessibility?
resources.description:
Accessibility is the practice of designing and developing products that
							are usable by people with disabilities.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: Accessibility guidelines for UX Designers
resources.description:
As a UX designer, it is important to build empathy and celebrate
							accessibility requirements as a set of design constraints to build a better product.
resources.author: Avinash Kaur

resources.title: Accessibility for user experience (UX) designers
resources.description:
Accessibility is a set of design principles that help people with
							disabilities use websites, mobile apps, and other digital products.
resources.author: Accessibility US Gov

resources.title: Accessibility in UX: The case for radical empathy
resources.description:
Imagine you were left-handed (and if you are, reflect on your
							left-handedness). You are part of a 10% minority in the world. Adjusting to certain tasks
							takes longer — but help in the form of left-handed stationery, sports equipment, etc. is
							available easily.
resources.author: Kriti Krishan

resources.title:
Accessibility in UX Design: Guidelines and Key
								Principles
resources.description:
Learn about the importance of accessibility in UX design. Understand the
							key principles involved in making designs more accessible to the target audience.
resources.author: Ramotion

resources.title:
7 Things Every Designer Needs to Know about
								Accessibility
resources.description:
Accessibility enables people with disabilities to perceive, understand,
							navigate, interact with, and contribute to the web. Imagine a world where developers know
							everything there is to know about accessibility.
resources.author: Jesse Hausler

resources.title:
Designing for Accessibility: Top 3 Strategies for UX
								Designers
resources.description:
Learn the top 3 strategies that every UX designer needs to know when it
							comes to designing for accessibility.
resources.author: Liz Brown UX

resources.title: Accessible Web Design: What Is It & How To Do It
resources.description:
In this video, we will be talking about what is accessible web design and
							how to do it.
resources.author: Flux Academy

resources.title: Designing for Accessibility: Overview
resources.description:
Designing for accessibility is important! Learn the ways you can help
							people with disabilities access your content online. We're here to help.
resources.author: Trillium Creative Solutions

resources.title: Design for Accessibility
resources.description:
Join Nissa in this webinar to learn how easy it is to implement simple
							strategies to ensure that your designs reach every person in your audience. Understand how
							people with different disabilities engage with your work. Learn how easy it is to make sure
							that everybody is included. Once you know it's not so hard to implement.
resources.author: Canva

resources.title: Design for Accessibility
resources.description:
In this video, we will be talking about how to design for accessibility.
							We will be talking about the color contrast accessibility, clickable area accessibility and
							common content accessibility
resources.author: UX Loop

resources.title: Designing for Accessibility
resources.description:
This recorded webinar provides a brief introduction to designing for
							accessibility: the importance of accessible design and high-impact practices digital content
							creators can apply to create accessible documents, images, audio, video, and web content.
resources.author: UA Technology Accessibility

resources.title: Design for internationalization
resources.description:
In this article, we will be talking about how to design for
							internationalization. We will be talking about the color contrast internationalization,
							clickable area internationalization and common content internationalization.
resources.author: John Saito

resources.title: Internationalization & Localization
resources.description:
So let’s say it turns out that you’ll need to localize the product /
							service you’re working on to certain countries. What are the main design aspects? This
							sketch summarizes some of the main things you need to pay attention to.
resources.author: Krisztina Szerovay

resources.title:
UX Localization: How to Adapt User Experience for International
								Users
resources.description:
That a visually stunning app won't be a hit if it can’t provide a
							stellar user experience (UX) is old news. It’s the whole reason UX design appeared on the
							tech map in the first place. What’s relatively new, though, is UX localization—the art of
							catering UX across borders.
resources.author: Phrase

resources.title:
Internationalization and Localization – Key Differences in App
								Design
resources.description:
Internationalization is crucial for startups and companies with global
							aspirations. If organizations want to succeed in an international market and compete
							locally, they must create relatable, locally relevant product experiences.
resources.author: UXPin

resources.title: Localization in UX: way beyond text translation
resources.description:
UX design helps companies to deliver the best solutions for their
							business while being respectful of users, not only with regards to their needs but also to
							their mindset and culture.
resources.author: Tania Conte

resources.title:
What Is Internationalization (I18N) - Localization
								Basics
resources.description:
Are you new to the localization industry? Learn the localization basics
							in these short whiteboard sessions. In this video, find out what is Internationalization
							(I18N).
resources.author: Localization Academy

resources.title: How to make design really inclusive
resources.description:
Florence Okoye tells us why empathy is good, but not enough, in the world
							of design. In an era of deep minds and deep learning, Florence believes it's time we
							start to design deeper and empower each other in the process.
resources.author: Florence Okoye

resources.title:
51. Design - Designing for Internationalization - User Interface
								Design
resources.description:
This episode: With Frederic Desbiens in this week's episode of the
							ADF Architecture TV series you will learn about the issues you need to take into account
							when designing user interfaces for internationalization.
resources.author: Frederic Desbiens

resources.title:
50. Design - Designing for Internationalization - Understanding
								Internationalization
resources.description:
This episode: In this week's episode of the ADF Architecture TV
							series Frederic Desbiens explores the basic concepts of internationalization (i18n) and
							explains why it involves much more than simply translating the user interface.
resources.author: Frederic Desbiens

resources.title: Everything you need to know about Design Systems
resources.description:
Design Systems have become a key part of my everyday work… And from
							discussions around me, it seems that it is now the case for a lot of people
resources.author: Audrey Hacq

resources.title: A comprehensive guide to design systems
resources.description:
Companies like Airbnb, Uber, and IBM have changed the ways they design
							digital products by incorporating their own unique design systems.
resources.author: Will Fanguy

resources.title: Design Systems 101
resources.description:
A design system is a set of standards to manage design at scale by
							reducing redundancy while creating a shared language and visual consistency across different
							pages and channels.
resources.author: Therese Fessenden

resources.title: Design Systems
resources.description:
A design system is a library of reusable components and guidelines that
							people within a company can combine into interfaces and interactions. What goes into a
							design system and how it is implemented can vary quite a bit from company to company,
							depending on the size and maturity of the design practice and the needs of the product team.
resources.author: Interaction Design Foundation

resources.title:
What is a Design System? Design Systems 101 for
								Designers
resources.description:
Today, we'll take a deep dive into the world of design systems and
							figure out exactly what they are. We'll take a look at a few definitions and several
							examples of actual design systems in the real world. By the end, you should have a solid
							understanding of what a design system actually is, and then (shortly) I will show you how to
							create one.
resources.author: DesignCourse

resources.title: Create a Design System with Figma - Full Course
resources.description:
Learn how to build a design system in Figma. By the end of this course
							you will become a master of building design systems in Figma and understanding master
							components.
resources.author: freeCodeCamp

resources.title: Build it in Figma: Create a Design System
resources.description:
Create your style guide, type scale, and brand color scheme and turn them
							into shared styles, grids, and typography to kick off designing a design system from
							scratch.
resources.author: Figma

resources.title:
Design Systems, Pattern Libraries & Style Guides... Oh
								My!
resources.description:
Style Guides, Pattern Libraries, and Design systems are all anyone is
							talking about lately, and for good reason. They all share a similar goal of creating a more
							consistent design process that increases productivity and also effectiveness. Some people
							don’t know the difference, so let's break them all down.
resources.author: Jesse Showalter

resources.title:
5 Best Design Systems and How to Learn (and Steal) From
								Them
resources.description:
Design systems (like Material Design, and Lightning Design) are all the
							rage and while most articles talk about what a design system is and best practices for
							creating them, at DesignerUp we've been framing them as a teaching tool and design
							tutorial with our product design students to help them better understand, explore and learn
							the philosophies, best practices and principles of UI design, UX and Product Design.
resources.author: DesignerUp

resources.title: Design System Series
resources.description:
In this video series, I'll be talking about design systems, how to
							build them, and how to use them.
resources.author: Mizko

resources.title: A Definitive Guide to Voice User Interface Design
resources.description:
When we stop for a moment and think about how popular voice-controlled
							devices and virtual assistants have become, it is only necessary to look deeper into the VUI
							design and learn more.
resources.author: Mert Aktas

resources.title: What are Voice User Interfaces?
resources.description:
Voice user interfaces (VUIs) allow the user to interact with a system
							through voice or speech commands. Virtual assistants, such as Siri, Google Assistant, and
							Alexa, are examples of VUIs.
resources.author: Interaction Design Foundation

resources.title:
Everything You Want To Know About Creating Voice User
								Interfaces
resources.description:
reating voice user interfaces requires a lot of design expertise in
							various areas such as conversation design, interaction design, visual and motion design.
							This article covers the most critical aspects of designing for voice user interfaces —
							designing the conversation and designing visual interfaces.
resources.author: Nick Babich & Gleb Kuznetsov

resources.title:
Voice User Interface Design, Examples & Advantages of
								VUI
resources.description:
Voice user interface (VUI) has been a regular feature of trending
							technology lists in the last few years.
resources.author: Paweł Kański

resources.title: VUI: Designing for Voice UI
resources.description:
Just about every product features a voice user interface (VUI), from
							phones, wearables, and speakers to your car and even the fridge. According to Statista, the
							number of voice assistant devices will exceed 8.4 billion units by 2024-more than the
							world’s population.
resources.author: UXPin

resources.title: Designing a VUI – Voice User Interface
resources.description:
Discover why conversational UIs and voice apps are surging in popularity
							and learn how to design voice user interfaces (VUIs) for both mobile and smart home
							speakers.
resources.author: Frederik Goossens

resources.title: Designing Voice Experience
resources.description:
As a voice user experience designer, I’ve worked with Fortune 500
							companies to help improve their speech applications. In this article, I want to share my
							experience on what are some of the things you should think about when designing for voice.
resources.author: Arun George

resources.title:
The Voice Design Process For Voice User Interfaces
								(VUIs)
resources.description:
If you’ve found yourself wondering where to begin the Voice Design
							Process, you’ve come to the right place! Since voice interface design is so rapidly
							evolving, there aren’t many resources out there for a clear process or path to designing
							voice interactions.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: How to Improve Voice User Interface Design
resources.description:
Houndify combines the smartest voice AI with engineering expertise to
							help brands build conversational voice assistants. From proprietary components to a
							customizable and scalable voice AI platform, we have the tools to build a highly accurate
							and responsive voice user interface.
resources.author: SoundHound

resources.title: Designing Voice User Interfaces"
resources.description:
Curious about the future of conversational interfaces? Join Cathy Pearl,
							Head of Conversation Design Outreach at Google and author of Designing Voice User
							Interfaces, as she demystifies this rapidly-growing field and provides best practices for
							building engaging and effective conversational systems.
resources.author: Cathy Pearl

resources.title: Leap Into VR/AR Design
resources.description:
Virtual reality is no longer in the realm of science fiction. Immersive
							technology desperately needs skilled designers to jump in, get involved, take risks, and
							create something new. Leap into VR/AR!
resources.author: Ted Evans

resources.title:
Introduction - The Design of Virtual and Augmented
								Reality
resources.description:
Good virtual and augmented reality adapts to the diversity of humans as
							multifaceted, intersectional, and complex beings. We as designers have the opportunity (and
							responsibility) to create experiences that are inclusive, accessible, and equitable.
resources.author: Aliheston

resources.title: UI/UX: Designing for AR & VR
resources.description:
Understanding augmented reality, virtual reality, and designing for AR/VR
							experiences.
resources.author: Nick Lawrence

resources.title: The hierarchy of needs in virtual reality development
resources.description:
There’s a certain anxiety in the VR community that surfaces in many
							conference panels and interviews with industry leaders: plenty of veterans are worried that
							this latest flowering of the technology will end with the same commercial disappointment
							that we saw in previous decades.
resources.author: Beau Cronin

resources.title: Speculations on neuro-motivated design for VR
resources.description:
Humans are really good at understanding, moving around, and solving
							problems in three-dimensional environments.
resources.author: Beau Cronin

resources.title: From Product Design to Virtual Reality
resources.description:
I am a product designer at Google, and I joined the company through
							Sparrow, a French startup that got acquired on July 20, 2012. Since then, I worked with the
							Gmail team to build from scratch a flagship product that became Inbox by Gmail. It shipped
							on October 22, 2014.
resources.author: Jean-Marc Denis

resources.title: Immersive Design
resources.description:
The Nintendo “Virtual Boy” was released in the United States in 1995 and
							discontinued in 1996 — making it the white whale of gaming tech in our little home town. My
							youngest brother spotted one at a garage sale and traded the sweat of his summer labor for a
							glimpse into the future.
resources.author: Matt Sundstrom

resources.title: 5 Lessons I Learned From Designing the VRUI of Beloola
resources.description:
The future of social media is in Virtual Reality, no doubt about that.
							But we’re not there yet. It will take a couple of months or even years for the masses to be
							able to get their first VR HMDs, which makes enough time for us to switch from 3D Web to Web
							VR — and actually we are already doing pretty good stuff in VR.
resources.author: Vincient Munoz

resources.title: The UX of VR
resources.description:
The rise of a new medium: virtual reality (VR). And with this comes a new
							set of challenges that give UX designers the opportunity to build a new grammar and
							symbology.
resources.author: Creative Bloq

resources.title: Designing VR UI in Figma and testing it with no code
resources.description:
UI has been in constant evolution since 1973 when Xerox Palo Alto
							Research Center created the first UI as we know it nowadays. Read more about the evolution
							of UI in this article “UI Evolution: From Computers To Virtual Reality Headsets”.
resources.author: Albertmauri

resources.title: VR Interface Design Pre-Visualisation Methods
resources.description:
Virtual reality provides new opportunities for user interactions with
							computer applications. The process of designing a comprehensive interaction paradigm will
							require a significant amount of consideration and development.
resources.author: Mike Alger

resources.title: UI/UX design for WebVR
resources.description:
Josh Carpenter (@joshcarpenter) is a UX Designer with Mozilla, currently
							focusing on virtual reality and the open web. He has worked previously in architectural
							visualization, building automation, motion graphics and digital services, the common thread
							always being a fascination with the intersection of digital design and the built
							environment.
resources.author: Josh Carpenter

resources.title: Google I/O 2015 - Designing for virtual reality
resources.description:
Designing great user experiences in virtual reality is considerably
							different than designing for the more traditional 2D form factors that you may be familiar
							with. Virtual reality introduces a new set of physiological and ergonomic considerations to
							your design work.
resources.author: Google

resources.title:
Oculus Connect 2: Navigating New Worlds: Designing UI and UX in
								VR
resources.description:
Oculus Connect 2 is our second annual developer conference where
							engineers, designers, and creatives from around the world come together to learn about the
							future of the Oculus platform and push virtual reality forward.
resources.author: Meta Quest

resources.title:
How to Prototype AR and VR UI/UX with FIGMA and UNITY!
								(Tutorial)
resources.description:
In this tutorial, we will go over the fundamental skills and tricks you
							need to create UI for Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality(VR). From understanding
							field of vision and comfort, to exporting and building your designs in Unity, it's one
							hell of a ride!
resources.author: Daniel Marqusee

resources.title: Designing for AR - UX/UI Case Study
resources.description:
UX/UI design case study about my first hands-on work experience with AR
							(augmented reality). I have created my own design concept for skateboarding and explored the
							design process behind creating a simple AR view screen.
resources.author: Ales Nesetril

resources.title: Building a VR app in Figma
resources.description: In this video, I will be showing you how to build a VR app in Figma.
resources.author: Akash Yadav

resources.title:
Designing UI/UX for VR - How to Quickly Prototype with Figma and
								Unity 3D
resources.description:
In this tutorial, we will go over the fundamental skills and tricks you
							need to create UI for Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality(VR). From understanding
							field of vision and comfort, to exporting and building your designs in Unity, it's one
							hell of a ride!
resources.author: Eva Kuttichova

chapters.title: Designing for AI and Machine Learning

resources.title: Design for AI: What should people who design AI know?
resources.description:
It’s 2023 and we are in the early days of artificial intelligence design.
							We’re certainly not “there” yet (i.e., you’re not running into Commander Data at the bar)
							but we do have a substantial cadre of narrow AI capabilities sprinkled throughout our daily
							lives.
resources.author: Hal Wuertz

resources.title: ML+DESIGN
resources.description:
A collection of resources for intersection of design, user experience,
							machine learning and artificial intelligence
resources.author: ML+Design

resources.title:
The Present and Future of AI in Design (with
								Infographic)
resources.description:
AI has become an over-hyped buzzword and the design world is no
							exception. Instead of resisting it, designers will soon be co-creating with AI. It will make
							them smarter. (Includes infographic)
resources.author: Miklos Philips

resources.title: 7 Ways to Get Started Designing for AI/ML Products
resources.description:
What you need to know when designing products using AI and Machine
							Learning
resources.author: Lola Salehu

resources.title: Introduction to Machine Learning as a Designer
resources.description:
Why should I be involved in machine learning as a designer? What do
							algorithms and prediction have to do with UX design? Every day, the reason becomes clearer.
resources.author: Aijay Odiaka

resources.title: Design for Machine Learning
resources.description:
Picture this. It’s Wednesday afternoon, and we’re ideating new product
							offerings to solve customer problems we uncovered.
resources.author: George Wang

resources.title:
AI & Machine Learning Will Change UX Research &
								Design
resources.description:
At the virtual UX Conference, Jakob Nielsen was asked "How will #AI
							and Machine Learning affect #UX Research & Design?"
resources.author: NNgroup

resources.title: Designing AI Experiences
resources.description:
Mouse to Keyboard to A.I. — A designers journey. Adrian Zumbrunnen is an
							independent UX Designer and writer, currently design tinkering at Google where he’s worked
							on products like Google AdWords, Google Maps and most recently Google Assistant and Allo.
resources.author: Adrian Zumbrunnen

resources.title: Amazing New UX/UI Design Tools + AI Tools - August 2022
resources.description:
These amazing UX/UI design tools that I discovered will help you improve
							your design process. We are going through some AI design tools like midjourney.
resources.author: Punit Chawla

resources.title: How to nail your UX research strategy
resources.description:
The old anecdote goes that ‘anything worth doing at all is worth doing
							well’, and UX research is no different. If you’re investing time and resources into UX
							research, it deserves to be conducted properly.
resources.author: Maze

resources.title:
How to Conduct User Experience Research Like a
								Professional
resources.description:
User experience research is a crucial part of the design process. It
							helps us understand our users, their needs, and how we can best meet those needs.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title: The Ultimate Guide to UX Research Strategy
resources.description:
User-centric designers, PMs, and researchers often repeat this phrase,
							like a prayer, as they try to convince internal stakeholders that user need is not the same
							as stakeholder want.
resources.author: Carrie Boyd

resources.title: How To Do A UX Competitor Analysis: A Step By Step Guide
resources.description:
Getting to grips with the ins and outs of a UX competitor analysis can
							help you know your market, product and goals better.
resources.author: Steven Douglas

resources.title: UX analysis: best methods and key tools
resources.description:
User experience (UX) analysis helps you understand how users experience
							your website and product, so you can prioritize decisions about how to improve it for them
							and ensure the user experience is as frictionless and intuitive as possible.
resources.author: Hotjar

resources.title: Strategic & Reactionary User Research
resources.description:
User research is often initiated during a sprint, after a design is
							implemented, or is part of the MVP. But, mindfully planning research reaps far better
							results.
resources.author: NNgroup

resources.title:
What's UX Strategy? And Why You Should Have It In
								Place?
resources.description:
A UX strategy is preparing a roadmap before you start creating something
							or attempting to solve the problem to achieve business goals.
resources.author: Koru UX Design

resources.title:
How to create a UX Research Report – free template
								included!
resources.description:
Once you've gone out in the field and gathered your initial research
							insights, how do you relay this back to your team? In this video I walk you through how to
							create a foundational research report packed with insights that will help designers, product
							managers and content strategists on your team make product decisions.
resources.author: femke.design

resources.title: Content 101: Information Architecture
resources.description:
Information architecture is a process is often carried out by a team of
							UX designers, developers, content strategists, and other professionals.
resources.author: Theresa Putkey

resources.title: What is Content Strategy in UX?
resources.description:
Content strategy is part of the overall strategy of a business. Its
							purpose is to achieve business goals.
resources.author: Josh Fechter

resources.title: Complete Beginner’s Guide to Content Strategy
resources.description:
“Content” is everywhere. It’s ads and longform copy, images and videos,
							stories and metadata. But what’s the point of it all? That depends on the content strategy.
							Content strategy plans for valuable, findable, meaningful content.
resources.author: UX Booth

resources.title: The Comprehensive Guide to Information Architecture
resources.description:
As a standard part of the UX process, designers create information
							architecture when building products. Learn about information architecture—how designers and
							product managers build an IA using design principles, as well as IA tools and best
							practices.
resources.author: James Pikover

resources.title:
Full Workshop: Content Strategy & Information
								Architecture
resources.description:
Content strategy and information architecture are two of the most
							important parts of the UX process.
resources.author: Flux Academy

resources.title:
Plan Before You Build: Information Architecture & Content
								Strategy
resources.description:
If you’ve been doing websites for clients for a while, you know the
							hardest thing to get out of them is their CONTENT. What if you could create an information
							model for their business, how pertinent information can be re-used, modeled and promoted to
							develop a Content strategy for your clients?
resources.author: Jim True

resources.title:
Case Study: The Role of Information Architecture in Adaptive
								Content Strategy
resources.description:
The authors at Eli Lilly’s Global Medical Information team have
							transformed from traditional authoring to authoring adaptive components of content. The
							transformation was approached in a pragmatic way starting from changing writing behaviors,
							streamlining processes, and implementing a new component authoring technology.
resources.author: Eli Lilly

resources.title: What's a Design Sprint and why is it important?
resources.description:
I recently had the opportunity to participate in a masterclass called
							“Dive into Design Sprints” organised by More Space For Light.
resources.author: Gloria Lo

resources.title: Design Sprints
resources.description:
Design Sprints are a five-day process for answering critical business
							questions through design, prototyping, and testing ideas with customers.
resources.author: Interaction Design Foundation

resources.title: What Are Design Sprints?
resources.description:
If you’re involved in any aspect of product design, UX design, or
							marketing, you’ve likely heard the term “design sprints”.
resources.author: John Cheung

resources.title:
I ran a one-person Design Sprint to create my UX/UI design
								portfolio
resources.description:
Design Sprint is a method to solve big problems and test new ideas in
							just five days. Originally it’s made for teams, to build better products faster.
resources.author: Laura Eiche

resources.title: How to Conduct an Effective Design Sprint
resources.description:
A design sprint is a methodology used to validate ideas through design,
							prototyping, user testing, and collaboration in only five days, offering a more structured,
							effective approach to creative thinking.
resources.author: Ondřej Dostál

resources.title: The UX Sprint
resources.description:
A repeatable two-week process for shipping high-quality tested UX and UI
							design rapidly.
resources.author: Johannes Holl & Thorsten Moser

resources.title: UX vs Design Thinking vs Design Sprint
resources.description:
As a UX designer who employs design sprints, design thinking and deep UX
							research and design methods, it's mind-boggling why the industry is becoming so
							fragmented.
resources.author: vaexperience

resources.title: An Introduction To Design Thinking & Design Sprints
resources.description:
If you’re getting started in the world of UX design, you’ll have likely
							heard of the terms “design thinking” and “design sprints.” But what do these two terms mean,
							how are they related, and how will having a better understanding of their relevance, and
							application, help you as a designer?
resources.author: Rob Hamblem

resources.title: What is a Design Sprint?
resources.description:
Take a look around the room you’re in right now. Notice the ergonomics of
							your chair? What about the device you’re using to play this video on right now? Almost
							everything around you started off as a design problem or design challenge.
resources.author: Google

resources.title: Design Sprint 2.0: Every Excercise
resources.description:
Introducing the Design Sprint 2.0! This is the 2019 version of the ever
							efficient Design Sprint. With new updates, improvements and hacks to make it even BETTER!
resources.author: AJ&Smart

resources.title: Tips For Your First Great UX Portfolio
resources.description:
Every UX designer has a portfolio, no matter how long they’ve been in the
							industry or how much experience they have. Whether you’re a brand new designer with just one
							project under your belt, or a seasoned expert with years in the industry, you must have a
							polished, up-to-date portfolio.
resources.author: CareerFoundry

resources.title:
The Best UX Designer Portfolios – Inspiring Case Studies and
								Examples
resources.description:
What makes a winning UX portfolio? More than a showcase of skills, a UX
							designer’s portfolio is an opportunity for them to create an enjoyable user experience as
							well as demonstrate their UX mastery.
resources.author: Miklos Philips

resources.title: How To Build a UI Portfolio [2023 Career Guide]
resources.description:
To land a job in UI design you’ll need an outstanding portfolio. A UI
							portfolio is more than a roundup of your best work. It’s an opportunity to showcase your
							design process and illustrate the tangible ways that you create value.
resources.author: Lizzie Parmenter

resources.title:
110+ Essential User Experience Portfolios for
								Inspiration
resources.description:
In this article, we’ll take a look at 110+ of the best UX portfolios from
							around the web.
resources.author: Zacharia Curtis

resources.title:
Expert Tips for Creating a UX/UI Portfolio That Stands
								Out
resources.description:
A designer's portfolio is their main tool for finding his dream job.
							It is not enough to prepare a resume in which you write about how of a great specialist you
							are and what skills you have.
resources.author: Victoria

resources.title:
How to Create Your UX/UI Portfolio (Without Much
								Experience)
resources.description:
In some ways, this seems like an insurmountable obstacle. Abandon all
							hope! The spiral of pessimism will win! You can never transition careers!
resources.author: Erik D. Kennedy

resources.title: My First UX Design Portfolio - Advice for Beginners
resources.description:
Hi! I recently graduated from UX bootcamp and I created my first UX
							design portfolio. I'm not an expert on the subject, but I do know how overwhelming it
							can be to create your first UX portfolio from scratch, so I wanted to share some tips and
							advice for any other UX designers in the same boat.
resources.author: Tanya Niu

resources.title: How to prepare your design portfolio / Design Tutorial
resources.description:
Using our example, we show and tell how to design projects in a portfolio
							so that it looks presentable and tasty, and most importantly - generate new leads.
resources.author: Cuberto Design

resources.title:
How to Build a UX Design Portfolio Website with Notion for FREE
								[Step-by-Step Tutorial]
resources.description:
Learn how to create an impressive design portfolio using Notion and
							Figma! In this tutorial, we'll walk you through the step-by-step process of building a
							UI/UX or product design website portfolio.
resources.author: Aliena Cai

resources.title: What are UX Case Studies?
resources.description:
UX case studies are examples of design work which designers include in
							their portfolio.
resources.author: Interaction Design Foundation

resources.title: How to write a UX case study
resources.description:
A good case study tells the story behind a design — the research,
							decisions, and process that went into its creation.
resources.author: Ariana Shives

resources.title: How to write a UX case study
resources.description:
Have you ever been told your UX portfolio lacks depth, or what you did is
							unclear, or that it doesn’t seem like you have enough experience, even though you know you
							do?
resources.author: Sarah Doody

resources.title: 8 step guide to write an amazing UX Case study
resources.description:
See, creating UX case studies for your UX design portfolio is a very
							strong way that can help you stand out among the crowd. Writing a UX case study is simple.
							However there are certain things that you need to make sure while you create it.
resources.author: Reetika Gupta

resources.title:
UX Portfolio Case Study template (plus examples from successful
								hires)
resources.description:
Your portfolio is the most critical piece of the puzzle when it comes to
							selling your design skills to recruiters and clients. It’s the single most vital component
							of any design career move you will ever make.
resources.author: Calvin

resources.title:
How to Craft an Outstanding Case Study for Your UX
								Portfolio
resources.description:
Writing case studies for your UX portfolio can feel opaque and
							overwhelming. There are so many examples out there, and often the ones that make the rounds
							are the stunning portfolios of top visual designers. It can be inspiring to see the most
							beautiful work, but don’t let that distract you from the straightforward format of a good UX
							case study.
resources.author: Jonny Grass

resources.title: How To Write a UX Case Study in 5 Steps
resources.description:
When you’re starting out as a UX designer, you know that you need case
							studies for your portfolio. People have different expectations for UX case studies, but
							we’ll give you the 5 basic elements they should all include. ‍
resources.author: Cameron Chapman

resources.title: How to Write a UX Case Study: Template and Examples
resources.description:
Ready to land your dream job? Designing a few UX case studies for your
							portfolio is a powerful way to help you stand out among the crowd.
resources.author: Justin Morales

resources.title: How to build your own case study
resources.description:
A few weeks ago I sat down to do what I always do after finishing up a
							DALI Lab project: document it on Medium, complete with section headings, bullet points and
							lots of wireframe PNGs.
resources.author: Emma Demers

resources.title: How to Present a UX Case Study in a Job Interview
resources.description:
In this video, I’ll show you how to present a UX case study in a job
							interview.
resources.author: Mizko

resources.title:
How to Write & Structure Your UX Case Study - Website
								Presentation Design
resources.description:
This is a walk-through of how to write, present and structure your UX
							case study material on your portfolio website.
resources.author: Sharon Yeun Kim

resources.title: UX case study that got me hired - A walkthrough
resources.description: In this video, I’ll walk you through a UX case study that got me hired.
resources.author: Anfisa Bogomolova

resources.title: How to Outline & Write your UX Case Study
resources.description:
Many designers have some self-doubt when it comes to writing, so today
							I'm going to show you how I outline my UX case study, what I include, and exactly what
							I've written so that you can learn from a real example.
resources.author: Maddy Beard

resources.title: UX Portfolio - How to Create a UX Case Study
resources.description:
In this video, you’ll learn what makes a great UX case study. I shared
							one of my first case studies (Houzz mobile app), which turned into an awesome project in my
							portfolio, and helped me land my first UX job in the Silicon Valley.
resources.author: Yobi

resources.title: Writing the Perfect UI/UX Case Study!
resources.description:
The intent of this ui/ux case study video is not to demean or look down
							upon the work of another designer. It is just to provide valuable and actionable feedback
							for the benefit of everyone who is watching this video.
resources.author: Design Pilot
